content:
When I look into trying GitHub Copilot, it tells me that I can "Get Copilot from an organization" and one of the organization from which I can "Ask admin for access" is leanprover-community.

Does this mean we are paying for this / someone has given us access to Copilot? If so, is it free to add people to it?
No, we are not paying for it nor do we have access. (I think?)
If you have any form of academic affiliation you should be able to get it through github education / github campus (I think)
Yeah thanks, I’m looking into that, it’s a bit of a rigamarole.

Seems you have to sign up for "GitHub Global Campus", but I did that a ~few weeks ago, and now I don't know what to do to get Copilot. It seems to think all I have to do is go back to the Copilot page, but that is still asking for credit card info.
I think my GitHub education discount might have been inherited by the leanprover-community organization
So the moment you graduate you'll be picking up the tab for everyone's use?

Bolton Bailey said:

Seems you have to sign up for "GitHub Global Campus", but I did that a ~few weeks ago, and now I don't know what to do to get Copilot. It seems to think all I have to do is go back to the Copilot page, but that is still asking for credit card info.

If you just install the copilot plugin and sign in with your github account does it just work?

"Teachers" get it free. You have to signup for the Github classroom with verification and log in with the same account. I have used it this way for over an year now (I forget the signup details but it was fairly smooth).

It is also free for students.
